item.title: How Far Away is The Next Global Financial Collapse?
item.description:
How Far Away is The Next Global Financial Collapse?

At the same time, people may look back on the impending financial collapse in a few years from now, and say "We should have seen it coming". Over the past few months, there has been a lot of speculation regarding a new financial crisis.

item.title: Elliptic and LexisNexis bring bank-grade AML to Bitcoin
item.description:
Elliptic and LexisNexis bring bank-grade AML to Bitcoin

Blockchain intelligence outfit Elliptic is teaming up with LexisNexis Risk Solutions to bring what they claim is bank-grade risk management to Bitcoin. Elliptic will integrate LexisNexis's anti-money laundering risk management data into its Bitcoin transaction monitoring and compliance products.

item.title: Is BitGo To Blame For The Bitfinex Bitcoin Theft?
item.description:
Is BitGo To Blame For The Bitfinex Bitcoin Theft?

In light of the recent Bitfinex attack, BitGo revealed a rather interesting statement. The company claimed their own investigation has yielded no evidence of a breach of any of their servers during the Bitfinex attack. This is rather strange, as all of the missing funds was drained from multisignature wallets, which should be secured by BitGo's technology.

item.title: Why is it not possible to replay transactions?
item.description:
Why is it not possible to replay transactions?

Bitcoin Stack Exchange is a question and answer site for Bitcoin crypto-currency enthusiasts. Join them; it only takes a minute: Sign up Here's how it works: Anybody can ask a question Anybody can answer The best answers are voted up and rise to the top Transaction inputs use Unspent Transaction Outputs (UTXO).

item.title: zanetackett's comment from discussion "Bitfinex down due to bitcoin security breach"
item.description:
zanetackett's comment from discussion "Bitfinex down due to bitcoin security breach"

I can confirm that the loss from the hack stands at 119,756btc.

item.title: United Pharmacies Launches Bitcoin Payment Method for Convenience and Anonymity
item.description:
United Pharmacies Launches Bitcoin Payment Method for Convenience and Anonymity

United Pharmacies has joined the list of retailing outlets that accept bitcoin as a form of payment. United Pharmacies sells drugs whose o rder for personal use is legal in most countries including the U.S. and the U.K.

item.title: LexisNexis Aiming To Stop Bitcoin Bad Guys | PYMNTS.com
item.description:
LexisNexis Aiming To Stop Bitcoin Bad Guys | PYMNTS.com

Bitcoin appeals to many different people, including the nefarious ones that like the anonymity associated with digital currency. LexisNexis, the company that provides banks with anti-money laundering controls, is aiming to stop the bad guys in their tracks when using bitcoin for illegal activities and is teaming up with London startup Elliptic to do so.

item.title: LEOcoin, an Entrepreneur's Alternative for Bitcoin Moves to Proof of Stake
item.description:
LEOcoin, an Entrepreneur's Alternative for Bitcoin Moves to Proof of Stake

August 1, 2016 - LEOcoin, the cryptocurrency created by London-based LEOcoin Foundation has made an important change to its protocol to make it more robust and user-friendly. The organization reports successful migration from the previously used Proof of Work consensus protocol, similar to that of Bitcoin to a more efficient Proof of Stake consensus protocol.

item.title: Bitcoin Slump Factors: EU Regulation, Halving, ETC, Scaling Issue
item.description:
Bitcoin Slump Factors: EU Regulation, Halving, ETC, Scaling Issue

Aside the Bitfinex hack which is explicable, every time there is a drop in the price of Bitcoin - as we have seen in recent days - several unfounded factors tend to crop up to provide plausible cause. This article was written to look at issues that affect Bitcoin price and yet defy a collective reasoning of consensus among many users.
